intro: Cynanchum ethiopicum subsp. angolense, commonly known as the Angolan milkweed, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with a distinctive crown of苞片, which are often mistaken for petals. Its milky sap is a notable feature, containing latex that can be toxic. It is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
